intro: Lathyrus venetus f. acutifolius, commonly known as the acute-leaved sweet pea, is a botanical variant of the sweet pea species. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves with acute, lance-shaped leaflets. The flowers are typically pink to purple, with a spurred structure at the base of the petals. This form is native to southern Europe and thrives in temperate climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant in floral arrangements.
